yep, I'm just filing all this misery away in my short term memory, don't you
know, and by Feb it'll all be forgotten (I HOPE) ... and I'll *prob* FORGET
and tell ya'll to just *GET A GRIP*!!! haha!!! nooooo, I'll remember to be
VERY *PATIENT*, too <SMILES>
Pris

messages.messageBody:
ROFLOL, too funny!!! we just heard on the 5pm weather that we've had
another all time high of 111* ... we're
just breaking records right/left!!! sooooo, Llano and Dallas??? how high
did ya'll get today???

nowwwwwww, all you northerers, just remember ... when ya'll are digging out
from all the blizzards this winter, we'll listen while ya'll fuss about your
*weather news* :}

Pris ~> whine, whine, whine ...

From: "Kim S" <sinclai@...>

Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 5:04 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: how hot is it where º Uº R???


> This reminds me of a rather funny story. On a business trip, DH had
> to go visit the NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration)
> http://www.noaa.gov/ . One of the guys there told him that congress
> wanted to get rid of NOAA . Well, he told him, they couldn't. The
> congressmen told him, they didn't need that organization any more,
> that they could just get the weather reports from the Weather
> Channel. He said, "Sir, that is where the weather channel gets their
> information!"!!! True story!
>
> Kim--Southern California, where it is 84 degrees with a gentle breeze
> and rather nice today!
